New Records: Glenn Maxwell clubbed the fastest Twenty20 international century on Australian soil
Maxwell equalled Indian great Rohit Sharma with the most T20I centuries - five
Key Match Events: Maxwell blasted an unbeaten 120 from 55 balls
The West Indies managed 9-207 in reply
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia's total was the nation's fourth-highest in a T20I
Left-arm quick Spencer Johnson (2-39) replaced Sean Abbott who has also been ruled out of Tuesday's series finale because of a shoulder injury
Others: The 35-year-old Maxwell dominated an Australian innings also featuring cameos from Tim David (31no from 14 balls), captain Mitchell Marsh (29 from 12) and David Warner (22 from 19)
Maxwell reached his half-century from 25 balls and kept that pace to his ton, blending audacious shot-making with pure stroke play
Maxwell twice cleared the fence with switch-hits and also smacked a six over wide long-on measured by ball tracking to travel 109 metres

Maxwell reached his century from just 50 balls â€” two balls quicker than the previous fastest in a T20I in Australia, South African Rilee Rossouw's 52-ball ton against Bangladesh in Sydney at the 2022 World Cup
